column4: hello everybody, i had a kernel update today, and i dont see windows anymore when i reboot, how i fix this
sudo update-grub
See if that fixes it first.
i rather not touch the grub
Well that's what you have change :)
its just i have too many kernel to chose...if i remember i can delete some, just forgot how
?  You don't have to touch them.  This command will not change them.
last time i used upgrade grub...i had to log on the live cd loll....its a very scary cmd to me
Then don't run it.  I don't know what to tell you.  It is grub that is not allowing you to boot windows.
if i use upgrade grub...will it erase some kernels...just wondering
no
so how can i see windows when i reboot if it doesnt erase kernels
That command does not upgrade grub's software.  It actually updates the list of operating systems by scanning what ones are installed on the hdd.
i just see i dont have grub installed...maybe i install it, and be able to delete some kernels
You do have grub installed or Ubuntu would not boot.
is there a grub gui somewhere
i typed grub via terminal...tells me its not intalled
no
'grub' is not a command or a package.  run the command I told you and see if it fixes the problem.  sudo update-grub
i see windows in the log after udpate-grub, i reboot
Was that a question?
no
